questions.question: What is the difference between a class and an object?
options: A class is a blueprint for an object
An object is a blueprint for a class
A class is a physical entity
An object is a physical entity
questions.correct_answer: A class is a blueprint for an object

questions.question: What is the purpose of a constructor in Java?
options: To initialize the state of an object
questions.correct_answer: To initialize the state of an object

questions.question: What is the difference between a compiler and an interpreter?
options: A compiler translates a program into machine code
An interpreter translates a program into bytecode
questions.correct_answer: A compiler translates a program into machine code

questions.question: What is the difference between a procedural language and an object-oriented language?
options: Procedural languages are easier to learn
Object-oriented languages are easier to learn
questions.correct_answer: Object-oriented languages are easier to learn

questions.question: What is the difference between active and passive listening?
options: Active listening is when you are actively engaged in the conversation, while passive listening is when you are not paying attention.
Active listening is when you are not paying attention, while passive listening is when you are actively engaged in the conversation.
Active listening is when you are listening to the other person's words, while passive listening is when you are listening to their tone of voice.
Active listening is when you are listening to the other person's tone of voice, while passive listening is when you are listening to their words.
questions.correct_answer: Active listening is when you are actively engaged in the conversation, while passive listening is when you are not paying attention.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a type of reading comprehension strategy: skimming, scanning, or decoding?
What is the best way to improve your writing skills?
options: Read more, write more, and get feedback on your writing.
Read more, write less, and get feedback on your writing.
Read less, write more, and get feedback on your writing.
Read less, write less, and get feedback on your writing.
questions.correct_answer: Read more, write more, and get feedback on your writing.

questions.question: What is the best way to improve your speaking skills?
options: Practice speaking in front of a mirror, record yourself speaking, and get feedback on your speaking.
Practice speaking in front of a mirror, record yourself speaking, and don't get feedback on your speaking.
Practice speaking in front of a mirror, don't record yourself speaking, and get feedback on your speaking.
Practice speaking in front of a mirror, don't record yourself speaking, and don't get feedback on your speaking.
questions.correct_answer: Practice speaking in front of a mirror, record yourself speaking, and get feedback on your speaking.

questions.question: What is the difference between a formal and an informal email?
options: Formal emails are written in a more structured and professional way, while informal emails are written in a more casual and relaxed way.
Formal emails are written in a more casual and relaxed way, while informal emails are written in a more structured and professional way.
Formal emails are written in a more creative and expressive way, while informal emails are written in a more structured and professional way.
Formal emails are written in a more structured and professional way, while informal emails are written in a more creative and expressive way.
questions.correct_answer: Formal emails are written in a more structured and professional way, while informal emails are written in a more casual and relaxed way.

questions.question: What is the best way to start a conversation?
options: Make eye contact, smile, and introduce yourself.
Make eye contact, frown, and introduce yourself.
Don't make eye contact, smile, and introduce yourself.
Don't make eye contact, frown, and introduce yourself.
questions.correct_answer: Make eye contact, smile, and introduce yourself.

questions.question: What is the best way to end a conversation?
options: Thank the other person for their time, and say goodbye.
Thank the other person for their time, and don't say goodbye.
Don't thank the other person for their time, and say goodbye.
Don't thank the other person for their time, and don't say goodbye.
questions.correct_answer: Thank the other person for their time, and say goodbye.

Make it clear that feedback is not welcome

questions.question:
What is the ability to adjust to change?
Select from the following:
[i] adaptivity
[ii] flexibility
[iii] agility
[iv] adaptability

What are the four dimensions of agility?
Select from the following:
[i] people, process, strategy, and technology
[ii] people, process, structure, and strategy
[iii] people, process, structure, and technology
[iv] people, process, knowledge, and technology

What are the 3 stages of continuous learning?
Select from the following:
[i] observe, reflect, and act
[ii] observe, analyze, and act
[iii] observe, reflect, and change
[iv] observe, analyze, and change

What is the definition of continuous learning?
Select from the following:
[i] the ability to learn new things
[ii] the ability to unlearn old things
[iii] the ability to learn and unlearn new things
[iv] the ability to apply new things

questions.question: Scenario: You are in a meeting with your manager and they ask you to provide an update on a project.  You are not prepared for this and you do not have the information you need.  What do you do?
options: A. Tell your manager that you will get back to them with the update.
B. Pretend that you know what you are talking about.
C. Tell your manager that you are busy and you will not be able to provide an update.
D. Ask your manager to send you the information you need so you can provide an update.
